content.text: Show that the club has 240 women members
5 of the 240 women members play in a tournament
How many women members do **not** play in the tournament?
Calculate the total amount the 560 members pay in 2013
The adult fee of $198 in 2013 is \(5.6\%\) more than the fee in 2012
The annual membership fee in 2013 is $198 for each adult and $75 for each child
The club buys 36 tennis balls for \(9.50 and sells them to members for\) 0.75 each
Calculate the percentage profit the club makes
A tennis court is a rectangle with length \(23.7 \text{m}\) and width \(10.9 \text{m}\), each correct to 1 decimal place
Calculate the upper and lower bounds of the perimeter of the court
On the grid above, draw the image of shape \(P\) after reflection in the line \(y = -1\)
On the grid above, draw the image of shape \(P\) under the transformation represented by the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\)
On the grid above, draw the image of shape \(M\) after enlargement by scale factor 2, centre (5, 0)
On the grid below, draw the graph of \(y = 11x - 2x^2 - 12\) for \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 4.5\)
The table shows some values for the function \(y = 11x - 2x^2 - 12\) for \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 4.5\)
By drawing a suitable line, use your graph to solve the equation \(11x - 2x^2 = 11.\)
find the co-ordinates of the point \(P\),
The line \(y = mx + 2\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = 11x - 2x^2 - 12\) at the point \(P\)
Write down, in terms of \(x\), an expression for the number of large sacks which Paul buys
Rula buys a number of small sacks of fertiliser
Each small sack costs \(\$ 2\) less than a large sack
Write down, in terms of \(x\), an expression for the number of small sacks which Rula buys
Rula buys 4 more sacks than Paul
Write down an equation in \(x\) and show that it simplifies to \(2x^{2} - 3x - 27 = 0\)
Calculate the number of sacks which Paul buys
Paul buys a number of large sacks of fertiliser costing \(\) x\(each
Show that this rounds to \(44.4^{\circ}\), correct to 1 decimal place
The diagram shows triangle \(LMN\) with \(LM = 12 \text{cm}, LN = 15 \text{cm}\) and \(MN = 21 \text{cm}\)
The diagram shows triangle \(PQR\) with \(PQ = 6.4 \text{cm}\), angle \(PQR = 82^\circ\) and angle \(QPR = 43^\circ\)
Calculate the result of each of the following, if possible
If a calculation is not possible, write not possible in the answer space
does not wear a hat and does not wear a scarf,
wears a hat but does not wear a scarf,
wears a hat or a scarf but not both
If Ivan wears a hat and a scarf, the probability that he wears gloves is \(\frac{7}{10}\)
Calculate the probability that Ivan does **not** wear all three of hat, scarf and gloves
In this question, give all your answers as fractions
When Ivan goes to school in winter, the probability that he wears a hat is \(\frac{5}{8}\)
If he wears a hat, the probability that he wears a scarf is \(\frac{2}{3}\)
If he does not wear a hat, the probability that he wears a scarf is \(\frac{1}{6}\)
The diagram shows a prism of length \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
The cross section is a regular hexagon of side \(4\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the total surface area of the prism
Calculate the speed of the water through the pipe in centimetres per minute
When the 12 litre bucket is emptied into a circular pool, the water level rises by 5 mill
Calculate the radius of the pool correct to the nearest centimetre
Water flows through a cylindrical pipe of radius 0.74 cm
It fills a 12 litre bucket in 4 minutes
Write down the length of \(P_{2}P_{3}\) in the form \(\frac{\sqrt{a}}{b}\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers
Calculate the length of \(OP_{3}\) giving your answer in the form \(\frac{c}{d}\) where \(c\) and \(d\) are integers
Sidney now draws the lines \(P_{2}P_{3}\) and \(OP_{3}\)
Show that angle \(P_{1}OP_{2} = 18.4^{\circ}\), correct to 1 decimal place
Write down the size of angle \(P_{2}OP_{3}\)
The last triangle Sidney can draw without covering his first triangle is triangle \(OP_{(n-1)}P_n\)
